text: it's been a summer of constant questions
around the integrity of athletics now
with claims of a doping cover-up at the
highest level the man challenging to be
the next president of the sports world
governing body has come out fighting I
don't think anybody should underestimate
the anger that is felt in our sport in
the portrayal in the last few days of a
sport that has done historically
absolutely nothing we've led the way on
this and that in some way we sit on our
hands at best and at worst a complicit
in a cover-up that just is not borne out
by anything that we have done as a sport
in the last 15 years so why is Lord Coe
so upset at the weekend a german
documentary together with the Sunday
Times published leaked data from 12,000
blood tests spanning 11 years up to 2012
it claimed in that time 800 a fleet had
suspicious tests highly suggestive of
doping that were not followed up by the
I double AF athletics is world governing
body the I double AF released a
statement refuting outright any
suggestion of a cover-up The Sunday
Times has today defended its journalism
saying CO and the Federation's refusal
to accept criticism raises serious
questions over the commitment to
protecting clean athletes athletics has
a checkered past its history littered
with examples of famous names caught
cheating in recent years the biological
passport program has been introduced
helping drugs testers to decide what are
normal and abnormal blood values for an
individual but some athletes still don't
entirely trust the system the biological
passport scheme that was brought in was
meant to be there so that if suspicious
values were found then they could be
followed up on and that's the
disappointment for clean athletes
they're being let down Lord kome see
this as a declaration of war for fans of
athletics though the battle is to truly
believe what they're seeing
